stimulusHtml: Professor Jovan randomly assigns each student in her psychology class to one of three groups. Group X is required to post a journal entry each week in which they discuss some aspect of psychology in daily life. Group Y is required to take an online quiz about the material each week. Group Z was not instructed to do any additional activities. At the end of the class, Professor Jovan compares the final comprehensive exam scores for Groups X, Y, and Z. The results are shown in the figure. Which of the following psychological principles are best supported by the data in the figure?
choicesHtml: Applying concepts to real-world situations improves learning.
Massed practice can be an effective study strategy in some situations.
Context-dependent memory is important for performing well in test situations.
Repeated testing can improve learning and memory.
